title: The Mauryan Empire
description: Uncover the legacy of one of India's greatest empires, from its founding by Chandragupta to the reign of Ashoka the Great.

timelineJigsaw.title: Ancient India Timeline
timelineJigsaw.instruction: Arrange these historical events from the pre-Christ era in the correct chronological order.

Chandragupta Maurya conquers the Nanda Empire
Megasthenes, the Greek ambassador, visits the Mauryan court

Reign of Dasharatha Maurya begins

Mahavira delivers his first sermon

Battle of the Hydaspes (Alexander vs. Porus)
Alexander's army mutinies at the Beas River
Seleucus I Nicator establishes the Seleucid Empire

The Mauryan Empire is divided into provinces
A network of spies and informants is established

Punch-marked coins become widespread in the empire

Popular art forms like terracotta figurines flourish

Reign of Samprati, known for patronizing Jainism

The Mauryan Empire collapses
Megalithic culture flourishes in Southern India
The Sangam period begins (estimated)
The Chera dynasty is established
The Pandya dynasty establishes its capital at Madurai
The Chola dynasty gains prominence
Agriculture is the primary occupation in the Mauryan Empire
The state controls forests, mines, and irrigation
The Grand Trunk Road (Uttarapatha) facilitates trade
Maritime trade with the Hellenistic world increases
Guilds of artisans and merchants (shrenis) are formed
The caste system (varna) is well-established
Megasthenes describes a society divided into seven classes
Slavery exists, as mentioned in the Arthashastra
Women's position declines compared to the Vedic period
Ashoka's edicts promote social welfare and tolerance
Brahmanism (early Hinduism) is the dominant religion

Ashoka actively promotes Buddhism across his empire and abroad

The reign of Dhana Nanda, the last Nanda king
